comment.text: Protects against mitochondrial dysfunction during cellular stress by phosphorylating mitochondrial proteins. Involved in the clearance of damaged mitochondria via selective autophagy (mitophagy) by mediating activation and translocation of PRKN. Targets PRKN to dysfunctional depolarized mitochondria through the phosphorylation of MFN2. Activates PRKN in 2 steps: (1) by mediating phosphorylation at 'Ser-65' of PRKN and (2) mediating phosphorylation of ubiquitin, converting PRKN to its fully-active form (PubMed:24660806, PubMed:24751536, PubMed:24784582, PubMed:25527291).
ATP + a protein = ADP + a phosphoprotein.
Interacts with PRKN. Interacts with FBXO7. Forms a complex with PRKN and PARK7 (PubMed:19229105).
Localizes mostly in mitochondrion and the 2 proteolytic processed fragments of 55 kDa and 48 kDa localize mainly in cytosol.

Highly expressed in heart, skeletal muscle and testis, and at lower levels in brain, placenta, liver, kidney, pancreas, prostate, ovary and small intestine. Present in the embryonic testis from an early stage of development.
Autophosphorylation at Ser-228 and Ser-402 is essential for Parkin/PRKN recruitment to depolarized mitochondria.
Two shorter forms of 55 kDa and 48 kDa seem to be produced by proteolytic cleavage and localize mainly in cytosol.

disease.name: Parkinson disease 6
disease.description: A neurodegenerative disorder characterized by parkinsonian signs such as rigidity, resting tremor and bradykinesia. A subset of patients manifest additional symptoms including hyperreflexia, autonomic instability, dementia and psychiatric disturbances. Symptoms show diurnal fluctuation and can improve after sleep.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the protein kinase superfamily. Ser/Thr protein kinase family.

feature.description: In PARK6; strongly reduces interaction with PRKN.
In PARK6; unknown pathological significance; dbSNP:rs138050841.

In PARK6; has reduced autophosphorylation activity compared to wild-type; localizes to the mitochondria and immunogold experiments reveal that both wild-type and mutant proteins face the mitochondrial intermembrane space; dbSNP:rs768091663.
In a glioblastoma multiforme sample; somatic mutation; dbSNP:rs371854396.

In PARK6; fails to maintain mitochondrial membrane potential; has reduced autophosphorylation activity compared to wild-type; strongly reduces interaction with PRKN; decreases PRKN and SNCAIP ubiquitination and degradation; dbSNP:rs74315355.
In PARK6; decreases PRKN and SNCAIP ubiquitination and degradation; dbSNP:rs74315359.
In PARK6; strongly reduces interaction with PRKN; dbSNP:rs28940285.

Probable disease-associated mutation found in early-onset Parkinson disease with digenic inheritance; associated with Ser-39 mutation in PARK7 gene; decreases PRKN and SNCAIP ubiquitination and degradation; dbSNP:rs119451946.
May predispose to Parkinson disease development; shows decreased mitochondrial membrane potential under stress conditions; dbSNP:rs74315361.
